poem:
Title: "Tears in the Damascus Steel"

Plough of the earth, drawn onward
with the scream of discord. 
Trucks stumble into Gaza's womb,
bearing band-aids for the ulcer;
A sickly salve for peace. 

419, symbol of hope or hoax?
A mockery to the UN's silent tongue,
A dance on the minefield of human need. 

Bleed then, the nations of sanctions,
For it is love that finds no borders.
